title: Love Island's Jess Shears and Dom Lever share breastfeeding video
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Love Island’s Jess Shears and Dom Lever have shared a sweet video of the new mum breastfeeding their baby after they hit back at mum-shamers.

The pair, who met on the 2017 series of the show, welcomed their new arrival in early October.

Sharing a video on Instagram of the couple in the car, Dom told fans: ‘There is nothing more real than stopping at the services to breastfeed,’ before panning to his partner grinning away and giving the camera a thumbs up as she held the baby.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Real talk, the pair look over the moon about being new parents.

However, despite the little one barely being a week old, Jess has already faced criticism after she shared a video of herself in the gym days after she shared news of the birth.

Trolls took to the comments to ask why she was working out so soon in a judgmental tirade.

So Jess hit back with a kick-ass response that shut them all up.

‘Can people stop assuming they know anything about the birth of our child,’ she wrote. ‘Just because we chose to share an image yesterday doesn’t mean that’s when they were born.’

Preach, girl.

The new mum added: ‘Dom, baby and I are happy, healthy and recovering at our own rate.’

Jess and Dom are one of the show’s success stories (Picture: Getty Images for Cybex)

As Jess pointed out, the pair are keeping details about the new arrival very private, not telling fans the sex of the baby or their name.

Meanwhile, although she’s been sharing select videos and photos of the tot, we haven’t had a full glimpse of them just yet.

All in good time!

The sweet couple are one of Love Island’s success stories after they got engaged three months after leaving the Majorcan villa, later tying the knot in Mykonos.

They then announced they were expecting a child, alongside picture of their first scan as they held their respective ‘bumps.’

Jess, 26, wrote to her followers: ‘The best is yet to come’ while husband Dom, 28, added: ‘Living the dream.’
